moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4: This as a bid to control the center.
moves.2... d6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. d3: Already we can see that this game will hinge around the two e-pawns.
moves.4... g5: Confusing.  Black's motivation for this one is difficult to figure out.
moves.5. Bxg5: Obvious to take the hanging pawn, and pin the knight to the queen.
moves.5... Bg4: An attack on the queen, simple enough.
moves.6. Qxg4 Nxg4 7. Bxd8 Kxd8: White chooses to trade queens, and eliminate the bishop, exploiting his better control of the center (especially the d5 square).
moves.9. Bxf7: Another pawn en prise, and it's taken.
moves.9... Rf8 10. Bh5: White's bishop is chased off the square but continues its attack.
moves.10... c6: A decent hope to attack the d5 square, but a knight lost.
moves.11. Bxg4 d5: Having lost the knight, Black might as well press on.
moves.12. exd5 cxd5 13. Nxd5: Even more stupid on Black's part.  White's control over the center is almost complete.
moves.13... Nc6 14. c3: Black is trying to hold onto a little bit of the center.  White intends to press on to victory.
moves.14... e4 15. Ng5: A good attack by Black, but White has spotted something.
moves.15... exd3 16. Ne6+: Black has missed the triple fork.
moves.16... Kd7 17. Nxf8+: Black moves badly to escape the check and is met with the loss of a rook and a double check.
moves.17... Kd6 18. Nxh7 Kxd5: White will take another pawn.  He has the kingside completely at his mercy and can deal with the loss of a knight.
moves.19. Kd2: The king must get involved, as Black's is almost halfway across the board.
moves.19... Ke4 20. Bf3+: White will chase Black's king away.
moves.20... Kf4 21. Bxc6 bxc6 22. Rhe1: White, after eliminating some of Black's tools, is now ready for the last attack.
moves.22... Bxc3+ 23. bxc3: Why? Why? Why the useless sacrifice of his last minor piece?
moves.25. Re4+: Note how White has used the black pawn as a piece of protection and is able to attack instead of run away from Black's rook.
moves.30... Kf3 31. Re1 a5 32. Ne5+ Kf2 33. Nx: Now simply to queen and win easily.
moves.35... Kg3 36. c5 Kg4 37. c6 Kg5 38. c7 K: White was already winning when his king moved to the d2 square, but the use of the pawn as a shield allowed him an easier and more simple win.

gameName: The pawn as a maneuvering tool
